incidents.name: Flag targeting page down for flags with team maintainers in the new experience

incident_updates.body: The issue with flag targeting UI in the new experience has been resolved. Impacted services have returned to normal operation.

The issue with flag targeting UI in the new experience has been identified and a fix has been released. We are continuing to monitor the performance of impacted services. We will continue to update this page until it is resolved.

Some customers are experiencing error pages when visiting the flag targeting UI in the new experience. This appears to only impact flags that have team maintainers. Impacted customers should be able to revert to the old UI experience to manage these flags as a temporary workaround. 

We have identified the issue and are continuing our work to resolve it.

Flag Delivery is not impacted

We are investigating and will provide updates as they become available.

Flag Delivery is not impacted.

incident_updates.body: Our third party usage billing vendor has resolved this issue. Rendered customer usage data in the product is now up to date.

We are experiencing an issue with a third party usage billing vendor. Billing itself is not affected, but rendered customer usage in product may be undercounted since June 5th, 2024. We are working with the third party to recalculate the usage data. No data has been lost.

incidents.name: LaunchDarkly web application was unavailable

incident_updates.body:
From 2:35 - 2:44 PM (PT), the LaunchDarkly web application was unavailable. This incident has since been resolved.

This incident did not impact the Flag Delivery Network, event ingestion, or any REST APIs. It only affected the accessibility of the web application frontend.

incidents.name: Elevated error rates for server side SDKs initializing connections to LaunchDarkly streaming service (US)

incident_updates.body:
We observed elevated error rates for server-side SDKs initializing connections to LaunchDarkly streaming service on Feb 8, 2023, between 19:07 and 19:21 in the US region. The streaming service remained available and SDKs would establish connections successfully upon retrying.
There was no impact on flag evaluations or delivering streaming updates. Also, client-side SDKs and polling were not impacted.

incidents.name: Elevated error rates for server side SDKs initializing connections to LaunchDarkly streaming service (EU)

incident_updates.body:
We observed elevated error rates for server-side SDKs initializing connections to LaunchDarkly streaming service on Feb 8, 2023, between 18:42 and 18:51 UTC in the EU region. The streaming service remained available and SDKs would establish connections successfully upon retrying.
There was no impact on flag evaluations or delivering streaming updates. Also, client-side SDKs and polling were not impacted.

incidents.name: Elevated error rates for server side SDKs initializing connections to LaunchDarkly streaming service (APAC)

incident_updates.body:
We observed elevated error rates for server-side SDKs initializing connections to LaunchDarkly streaming service on Feb 8, 2023, between 18:08 and 18:23 UTC in the APAC region. The streaming service remained available and SDKs would establish connections successfully upon retrying.
There was no impact on flag evaluations or delivering streaming updates. Also, client-side SDKs and polling were not impacted.

incidents.name: Segments UI not loading

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

All customers are experiencing errors when trying to access segments management tab. We are investigating and will provide updates as they become available.

Flag Delivery is not impacted.

incidents.name: LaunchDarkly web application is experiencing an error

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. The web application error occurred on production from 11:04am PT to 11:31am PT.

We have identified an error in the LaunchDarkly web application. On first load, the application was displaying an error and the user could not proceed. The root cause has been identified and resolved.

The Flag delivery network and end-user flag evaluation is unaffected and performing normally.

incidents.name: Elevated error rate and latency for account usage charts

incident_updates.body: The issue with the account usage charts has been resolved. Impacted services have returned to normal operation. There was no data loss.
We are continuing to monitor the system as it processes the backlog. We estimate this process will be completed in 12 hours and will resolve this incident once the backlog has been fully consumed.

Account usage charts response latencies have recovered. The system has also processed most of the backlog. We are monitoring the results and will resolve this incident once the backlog has been fully consumed.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue. The system is processing the accumulated backlog and we are noticing improvement in API response times for the affected account usage charts.

We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue. The system has accumulated significant backlog. While recovery is in progress customers may experience degraded performance from accounts usage charts. There is no data loss, and no other systems are impacted. Next update will be morning Jan 10 PT.
We are continuing to work on the fix.
We are continuing to work on the fix.
We have identified the issue and are working on a fix.
We are investigating elevated error rate, latency and data delays for account usage charts. No other systems are impacted.

incidents.name: Elevated mobile streaming error rate in us-east-1

incident_updates.body:
We experienced an elevated level of connection errors on our mobile streaming APIs in the us-east-1 region between 9:00am and 9:57am PT.
Streaming connections outside of the us-east-1 region were unaffected. LaunchDarklys SDKs retried failed connection attempts and likely eventually succeeded during the incident time window.

incidents.name: Elevated mobile streaming error rate in APAC

incident_updates.body:
We experienced an elevated level of connection errors on our mobile streaming APIs in the APAC region. The issue occurred in periodic bursts occurring between 6:26pm and 8:32pm PT. The issue is now resolved.

Streaming connections outside of the APAC region were unaffected. LaunchDarklys SDKs retried failed connection attempts and likely eventually succeeded during the incident time window.

incidents.name: Unable to create expiring targets on segments

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

The LaunchDarkly web application is currently unable to create expiring targets on segments. Customers can create expiring targets on segments through the API as a temporary workaround.

The ability to create flag expiring targets is unaffected, as is the processing of expiring targets.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Flag Delivery Network (core functionality) - Polling API

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the performance of impacted services. Customers will see recovery of impacted services at this time.

affected_components.name: Flag Delivery Network (core functionality) - Polling API

incident_updates.body: We are investigating an elevated error rate establishing connections to polling SDK endpoints that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

incidents.name: Google signin and signup unavailable

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are continuing to implement the fix.

As a workaround, impacted users can sign in with their password. If they don't know their password or don't have one, they can reset their password to proceed with signing in.

The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

As a workaround, impacted users can sign in with their password. If they don't know their password or don't have one, they can reset their password to proceed with signing in.

Our Google authentication protocol is currently unavailable. We are working to restore access as quickly as possible and will update this page again once it is restored. All other authentication methods are still working and available.

incidents.name: Event Processing Delays

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Event processing is currently delayed for and will be showing stale data for Experimentation.

No data has been lost and the system should be caught up shortly.

incidents.name: Delayed flag updates for Cloudflare Edge SDKs

incident_updates.body: The issue with delays updating flags in Cloudflare Edge SDKs has been resolved. Impacted services have returned to normal operation.

affected_components.name: Flag Delivery Network (core functionality) - Edge API

incident_updates.body:
We are seeing an improvement in Cloudflare API with very few requests failing. We are continuing to monitor the performance of impacted services. We will continue to update this page until it is resolved.

Cloudflare incident can be followed at https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/hm7491k53ppg

affected_components.name: Flag Delivery Network (core functionality) - Edge API

incident_updates.body: We are observing slow recovery of Cloudflare API. Customers may still experience delayed flag updates. Cloudflare incident can be followed at https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/hm7491k53ppg

affected_components.name: Flag Delivery Network (core functionality) - Edge API

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare is still working on this issue.

affected_components.name: Flag Delivery Network (core functionality) - Edge API

incident_updates.body: The provider continues to work on the issue. LaunchDarkly Cloudflare SDKs and their flag evaluations will continue to work with their last known state. Customers may experience delays in observing flag updates pushed to their Cloudflare storage.

incidents.name: Context and user indexing delays

incident_updates.body: The issue with context and user indexing delays has been resolved. Processing backlog has been completed. Impacted services have returned to normal operation.
The system is processing the backlog. We expect the processing to be caught up in about 4 hours. We will continue monitoring and resolve the incident when that is completed.

The issue is fixed. The system is processing context and user indexing backlog. Customers may notice new contexts and users appear with a delay in their dashboards. There is no data loss. Other services are not impacted.
We have identified an issue resulting in delays indexing new contexts and users.
